p: Merkel cell carcinoma is a neuroendocrine malignancy of the skin which is most common in immunocompromised hosts including transplant recipients [ 173, 176]. Over 80% of these tumors contain a polyoma virus named Merkel Cell polyomavirus (MCPyV); virus has also been found in respiratory secretions in asymptomatic transplant recipients. Further study of each of these polyomaviruses is ongoing in the transplant population.
